descriptions.description: Ogg Vorbis is a fully open, non-proprietary, patent-and-royalty-free, general-purpose compressed audio format for mid to high quality (8kHz-48.0kHz, 16+ bit, polyphonic) audio and music at fixed and variable bitrates from 16 to 128 kbps/channel. This places Vorbis in the same competitive class as audio representations such as MPEG-4 (AAC), and similar to, but higher performance than MPEG-1/2 audio layer 3, MPEG-4 audio (TwinVQ), WMA and PAC.

set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=libogg PACKAGE_VERSION=1.3.1
oegimport flac oegimport libiconv oegimport gettext
#oegimport libtheora #oegimport libsdl # libSDL 1.2 or later for the playback example #oegimport libvorbis #speex #icecast
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.xz
mkdir -p "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}" #cp AUTHORS "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}/"
configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-gnu-ld --with-sysroot=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --enable-shared --disable-sqlite --bindir=${OEG_BASE_BIN_DIR} --libdir=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR} ${CONFIGURE_HOST_PARA} make make install-strip DESTDIR=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv bin/*.dll bin64/ rm -rf bin # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
